result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Ernest Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain a GED or HSED.
Complete a job training program.
No contact with the victim Stephanie H.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, unless previously done, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Ernest Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Return of petition for sentence adjustment as premature.
Original Transcript (18 pages) commencing 06/18/2015 CHANGE OF PLEA/ SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 42 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 21 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 21 MONTHS.
Credit for 102 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Stephanie H.
* Obtain a GED or HSED.
* Complete a job training program.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.    The Court ordered that the DNA surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees. and surcharges.   The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $600.00 payable to the victim, Stephanie H.   The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Clerk CANCELED the 07-22-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Charles Ernest Miller not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial dates.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 06-18-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 07-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/23/2015 received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Wisconsin State Public Defender, Attorney Vincent P. Guimont, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI 53203.

Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in custody.  Ron Dague for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Eric Brandt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Stephanie H; Nathaniel J; Anna A or their residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  
Defendant Charles Ernest Miller in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
